scenario_name: Q4 2025 Strategic Planning Offsite – NovaHealth Systems
company_context: NovaHealth Systems is a $2.3 B digital‑health platform that delivers tele‑medicine, AI‑driven diagnostics, and remote‑patient‑monitoring solutions to health systems and employers in the US and Canada. The executive team (CEO, CFO, COO, CMO, CTO, CPO, CSO, VP of Sales, VP of Engineering, VP of Customer Success) meets annually for a three‑day offsite to set the 3‑year strategic direction and FY26 OKRs.
meeting_event_details: September 9‑11 2025 (Thursday‑Saturday), 08:30‑18:30 each day, with evening networking on Sep 9‑10. Location: The Lodge at Aspen, Colorado (mountain resort conference center, 30‑person breakout rooms, high‑speed Wi‑Fi). External facilitator: Dr. Maya Patel (Strategic Horizons).
stakeholders: Laura Chen – Chief Executive Officer (overall vision, final decision authority)
David Alvarez – Chief Financial Officer (budget, capital allocation)
Sofia Martinez – Chief Operating Officer (execution roadmap, org design)
Dr. Ethan Patel – Chief Medical Officer (clinical strategy, regulatory impact)
Ravi Singh – Chief Technology Officer (AI platform roadmap, tech debt)
Megan O'Leary – Chief Product Officer (product portfolio prioritization)
Natalie Brooks – Chief Strategy Officer (facilitates scenario planning, competitive analysis)
James Liu – VP of Sales (go‑to‑market, partnership strategy)
Olivia Grant – VP of Engineering (resource planning, delivery cadence)
Carlos Reyes – VP of Customer Success (NPS trends, retention strategy)
Dr. Maya Patel – External Facilitator (process design, decision‑making framework)
deliverables: Approved Strategic Priority Matrix (AI diagnostics, International expansion, Partnership ecosystem)
FY26 OKR Sheet (company‑wide objectives with measurable key results)
Capital Allocation Plan (R&D $80 M, Acquisitions $40 M, Market expansion $30 M)
Revised Vision & Mission Statements
12‑Month Execution Roadmap (milestones, owners, timelines)
Risk Register and Mitigation Plan
Offsite Summary Deck (to be sent to Board within 5 days)
Company‑wide Communication Playbook (press release, internal rollout, town‑hall agenda)
success_criteria: Post‑offsite alignment survey average score ≥ 85 % across executives
Board approval of FY26 OKRs and capital plan by Oct 5 2025
All deliverables completed and distributed within the defined timelines
Actionable 12‑month roadmap with ≥ 90 % of milestones assigned to owners
constraints: Offsite limited to 3 full days (72 person‑hours total)
Offsite budget capped at $120,000 (venue, travel, facilitator fees)
Key pre‑work (market research, financial analysis) must be submitted by Aug 15 (T‑30)
Decisions must be finalized before the Board meeting on Oct 5 2025
Travel restrictions: all participants must have COVID‑19 vaccination proof and negative test within 48 hours of departure
workback_prompt: Generate a detailed work‑back plan for NovaHealth Systems' Q4 2025 Strategic Planning Offsite (September 9‑11, 2025, Aspen). Include all pre‑work (market research, financial analysis), facilitator preparation, agenda finalization, logistics (travel, lodging, tech setup), day‑by‑day session plans, decision‑making checkpoints, post‑offsite deliverable production, and communication rollout. Align tasks with the constraints (T‑90 horizon, $120k budget, pre‑work due Aug 15, Board approval by Oct 5) and map each deliverable to a responsible owner and due date. Provide the plan in a table format suitable for a project‑management tool.

company_context: Apex BioSolutions is a fast‑growing, publicly‑traded biotech company (NASDAQ: APXB) focused on next‑generation cell‑based immunotherapies for oncology and autoimmune diseases. The firm has $1.2 B in annual revenue, $850 M in cash, and a pipeline that includes two FDA‑approved CAR‑T products and three candidates in Phase 2. The executive team is preparing the 2025‑2027 strategic plan to decide on a new CAR‑NK platform, allocate a $200 M R&D budget, and set company‑wide OKRs aligned with a five‑year vision of becoming the market leader in off‑the‑shelf cell therapies.
meeting_event_details: Dates: Thursday June 10 2025 – Saturday June 12 2025 (3 days). Time: 8:30 am – 5:30 pm each day, with a half‑day off on Saturday (8:30 am – 12:30 pm). Location: The Lodge at Snowy River, 1450 Aspen Road, Aspen, Colorado (full‑board resort with conference facilities, high‑speed Wi‑Fi, and breakout rooms). The agenda includes market trend deep‑dives, competitive landscape workshops, visioning sessions, OKR formulation, and decision‑making panels.
stakeholders: Dr. Elena Martinez – Chief Executive Officer (overall sponsor, final decision authority)
James Liu – Chief Financial Officer (budget oversight, financial modeling)
Dr. Priya Nair – Chief Medical Officer (pipeline and clinical strategy)
Dr. Victor Chen – Chief Technology Officer (technology platform evaluation)
Laura Patel – Chief Revenue Officer (commercial strategy, market access)
Megan O'Connor – Chief Human Resources Officer (talent and organization design)
Ravi Desai – Chief Strategy Officer (facilitates internal sessions, owns OKR framework)
Maya Patel – Lead Facilitator, Strategic Edge Consulting (external facilitator, neutral process owner)
External Advisors: Dr. Susan Kline (Regulatory), Mark Reynolds (M&A), and Karen Brooks (Payer & Reimbursement)
Board Liaison: Thomas Greene – Corporate Secretary (ensures alignment with board expectations)
deliverables: Executive Summary Deck (10‑slide) capturing vision, strategic priorities, and OKRs
Detailed 3‑Year Financial Model (2025‑2027) with scenario analysis for new CAR‑NK platform
Competitive Landscape Matrix (incl. 12 global rivals, SWOT, market share forecasts)
R&D Portfolio Allocation Plan (budget split, milestones, go/no‑go gates)
Partnership & M&A Playbook (target criteria, deal pipeline, integration roadmap)
Action‑Item Tracker (owner, due date, KPI) for all decisions made
Board Briefing Package (full report + Q&A FAQ) to be delivered within 5 business days
success_criteria: All 5 strategic priorities are defined, ranked, and assigned owners by end of day 2
Consensus on 2025‑2026 OKRs achieved with ≥90 % alignment score in post‑session survey
Decision on CAR‑NK platform (go/no‑go) documented with supporting financial model and risk register
R&D budget allocation approved and signed off by CFO and CEO before day 3 close
Post‑offsite communication plan executed: executive summary sent to Board within 48 hours, town‑hall scheduled within 2 weeks, and action‑item tracker shared with all owners within 24 hours
constraints: Total offsite budget capped at $150 K (venue, travel, facilitator fees, materials)
All pre‑work (market research, financial analysis, customer insights) must be submitted to the facilitator by May 28 2025
Key external advisors have limited availability – must be scheduled for 2‑hour slots on June 10 and 11
Regulatory compliance: any discussion of unpublished data must be marked confidential and stored on encrypted drives
Travel restrictions: all attendees must have COVID‑19 vaccination proof and negative test within 72 hours of departure
workback_prompt: Generate a detailed work‑back plan for the Apex BioSolutions 2025 Strategic Planning Offsite (June 10‑12, 2025, Aspen, CO). Include all pre‑work deliverables (market research, financial models, SWOT, customer insights), facilitator preparation, agenda‑by‑hour, logistics (travel, lodging, tech setup), decision‑gate reviews, post‑offsite communication (Board brief, town‑hall, action‑item tracker), and risk mitigation steps. Align tasks with the constraints (budget $150K, pre‑work deadline May 28, external advisor availability) and success criteria (priority definition, OKR consensus, CAR‑NK decision, budget sign‑off, communication rollout). Output a timeline with owners, due dates, dependencies, and required resources.

scenario_name: Helios BioTech FY26 Strategic Planning Offsite
company_context: Helios BioTech, a $1.2B publicly‑traded biotechnology company focused on next‑generation gene‑editing therapies for rare genetic disorders. The executive team includes the CEO, CFO, COO, CMO, CRO, Chief Strategy Officer, VP of R&D, VP of Commercial, and CHRO. The offsite is the first full‑team strategic planning session since the Series D financing round and will set the direction for FY26 and beyond.
meeting_event_details: June 10‑12, 2025 (3 days). Arrival & welcome dinner June 10 at 6:00 PM, full agenda runs 8:30 AM–5:30 PM each day. Location: Aspen Mountain Resort, Aspen, Colorado (Conference Center A, rooms 101‑104, plus breakout spaces). All meals, transportation from Denver International Airport, and a one‑night team‑building ski activity are included.
stakeholders: Dr. Elena Ramirez – Chief Executive Officer (overall sponsor, final decision‑maker)
James Liu – Chief Financial Officer (budget, capital allocation)
Maya Patel – Chief Operating Officer (execution roadmap)
Dr. Priya Nair – Chief Medical Officer (pipeline prioritization)
Dr. Carlos Ortega – Chief Research Officer (R&D strategy)
Laura Chen – Chief Commercial Officer (market entry & partnership strategy)
Sanjay Patel – Chief Strategy Officer (facilitates scenario planning)
Aisha Khan – Chief Human Resources Officer (talent & culture alignment)
Dr. Maya Patel – External Facilitator, Senior Partner, StrategyBridge (neutral process owner)
External Advisors: Dr. Robert Stein (Regulatory), Ms. Vanessa Brooks (M&A counsel)
deliverables: Executive Summary Deck (10 slides) outlining FY26 vision, strategic priorities, and OKRs
Capital Allocation Model showing $200M investment plan across R&D, commercialization, and M&A
Go/No‑Go decision matrix for Phase III trial of Hemophilia‑B gene therapy
Competitive Landscape Heatmap with 5‑year trend projections
Revised 5‑Year Vision Statement and Mission Alignment Document
Action‑Item Register with owners, milestones, and owners for each strategic initiative
Communication Playbook for post‑offsite rollout (board brief, employee town‑hall, investor update)
success_criteria: All FY26 OKRs are defined, quantified, and assigned to owners within 48 hours of the offsite
Capital allocation model approved by CFO and board liaison by end of day 3
Phase III go/no‑go decision documented and signed off by CEO and CRO
Strategic partnership shortlist (minimum 3 candidates) agreed upon with evaluation criteria
Post‑offsite communication plan executed: board brief sent within 24 hours, employee town‑hall scheduled within 5 business days, investor update drafted within 7 days
Participant satisfaction ≥ 90 % (post‑event survey) and perceived clarity of direction ≥ 8/10
constraints: Total offsite budget capped at $250,000 (venue, travel, facilitation, materials)
All pre‑work (market research, financial analysis, competitor dossiers) must be submitted to the facilitator by May 20, 2025
Regulatory filing deadlines (e.g., IND amendment due July 15) limit the amount of time that can be allocated to new trial design discussions
Key external advisors (Regulatory, M&A counsel) are only available for 4 hours total across the three days
COVID‑19 travel restrictions require all participants to be fully vaccinated and present a negative test within 72 hours of arrival
workback_prompt: Create a detailed work‑back plan for the Helios BioTech FY26 Strategic Planning Offsite (June 10‑12, 2025). Include all pre‑work deliverables (market research, financial models, competitor analysis), facilitator preparation, logistics (travel, venue booking, catering), agenda development, breakout session planning, decision‑making checkpoints, post‑offsite communication rollout, and risk mitigation steps. Provide timelines, owners, dependencies, and milestones leading up to the offsite and through the first 30 days after the event, ensuring the success criteria and constraints listed in the scenario are met.
